etymology.description: 王(王) (wáng, "king"), 府(府) (fǔ, "official residence"), 井(井) (jǐng, "well")
etymology.interpretation: 王府井 (Wángfǔjǐng) historically referred to an area where there was an official residence, likely belonging to someone of high status ('king'), and a well. This area in Beijing is now a famous commercial district.

examples.chinese: 我今天去了王府井(我今天去了王府井)。
王府井是北京著名的商业区(王府井是北京著名的商業區)，每天吸引大量游客(每天吸引大量遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Wángfǔjǐng shì Běijīng zhùmíng de shāngyèqū, měitiān xīyǐn dàliàng yóukè.
examples.english: Wangfujing is a famous commercial district in Beijing, attracting a large number of tourists every day.
